ai-ps3.9:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ps3.9:1.3_0: While there, he addressed the monks:
ai-ps3.9:2.1_0: “Mendicants, it’s totally impossible for a mendicant who regards any condition as permanent, constantly, reproved, and patience.
ai-ps3.9:2.3_0: Talking upwards, he will enter the sure path with regards himself as one who is devoted to the highest.
ai-ps3.9:2.5_0: Having entered the sure path, they will realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.
ai-ps3.9:3.1_0: It’s totally impossible for a mendicant who regards all conditions as impermanent to accept views that agree with the teaching. ...”
